data.title: BTS songs, albums list: A complete guide to every single tune in order : Hypable
data.text:
If youâ€™re new to the ARMY and looking for more information on all of BTSâ€™ songs and albums, weâ€™re here to help! Hereâ€™s a complete list of BTSâ€™ discography as well as the meaning and inspiration behind the singles!

Latest update: We added the details for â€œButterâ€ which was released in May 2021!

BTS released their first single on June 12, 2013, and have been releasing songs and albums non-stop ever since then. Itâ€™s especially impressive when you look at how involved all of the BTS members are in the process of creating music, from helping to write lyrics and even producing some tracks as well.

In the years since BTSâ€™ first album, theyâ€™ve racked up an impressive discography that includes both Korean and Japanese albums. All of BTSâ€™ songs and albums have personal meanings and stories behind them.

Through all BTSâ€™ albums, you can track the membersâ€™ lives as they grew up and had to learn to deal with their ever-evolving fame. You can also hear their life together, channeling all of the challenges life threw their way into their music.

From discussing topics on growing up, pressures theyâ€™ve faced, mental health struggles, love and loss, dealing with others trying to tear them down, and learning to love themselves despite it all, the members have really become open books through their music.

The main members of BTS that have worked as producers and songwriters include RM (Kim Namjoon), Suga (Min Yoongi), and J-Hope (Jung Hoseok), though other members have worked on songs as well. Theyâ€™ve also worked as producers for other artists.

Want information about some of the BTS members solo projects? Jump to: BTS members mixtapes

Article Continues Below

All BTS albums in order:

BTS album list table of contents, in order of release:

â€˜2 Cool 4 Skoolâ€™

Release Date: June 12, 2013

2 Cool 4 Skool Tracklist:

1. Intro: 2 Cool 4 Skool (feat. DJ Friz)

2. We Are Bulletproof Pt.2

3. Skit: Circle Room Talk

4. No More Dream

5. Interlude

6. ì¢‹ì•„ìš” I Like It

7. Outro: Circle Room Cypher

8. Hidden Track: Skit: On The Start Line

9. Hidden Track: ê¸¸ Road/Path

â€œNo More Dreamâ€ was BTSâ€™ first single ever, and, impressively, the lyrics were written by BTS band members RM, Suga, and J-Hope along with their producers.

The lyrics to the single reveal a theme that the group revisited often in their early days: young people being pushed to go to school to fulfill the dreams of others and not necessarily their own.

J-Hope once explained that the lyrics touch on â€œthe anxiety that comes from the vague realities we face and that we should try to overcome such anxieties.â€

â€œWe Are Bulletproof Pt.2â€ was their second single from the album. The lyrics discuss the hardships the group had already faced by being looked down upon by others, but overcoming all of the attacks with their hard work and dedication.

Suga reviewed the album in a video and revealed that they wanted to convey how hard they had worked in their years of training and that they were confident with their debut.

â€˜O!RUL8,2?â€™

Release Date: September 11, 2013

O!RUL8,2? Tracklist:

1. Intro: O!RUL8,2?

2. N.O

3. We On

4. Skit: R U Happy Now?

5. If I Ruled The World

6. Coffee

7. BTS Cypher Pt.1

8. ì§„ê²©ì˜ ë°©íƒ„ Attack on Bangtan

9. íŒ”ë„ê°•ì‚° Paldo Gangsan/Satoori Rap

10. OUTRO : Luv In Skool

â€œN.Oâ€ was the title track of O!RUL8,2?, and similarly to their first single â€œNo More Dream,â€ â€œN.Oâ€ is about the pressure on students to become â€œstudying machines,â€ even when it sacrifices their own dreams and happiness.

This theme is also displayed in the music video for â€œN.Oâ€ where BTS members play students being fed pills in a classroom setting to make them complacent for their studies.

â€œAttack on Bangtanâ€ (also known as â€œThe Rise of Bangtanâ€) didnâ€™t get its own official music video but became a popular track from the album and was used during promotions for the album.

The song features a more energetic and fun beat than their previous singles, while the lyrics warn other idols about the impending rise of the band as they use their fire to captivate fans.

â€˜Skool Luv Affairâ€™

Release Date: February 12, 2014

Skool Luv Affair Tracklist:

â€œBoy In Luvâ€ was the lead single of the album, and the lyrics of the song are about a typical high school crush, as well as a boysâ€™ confusion over having feelings for the girl.

Even with the cute theme of the song, BTS still put a hip-hop twist on the sound which makes it stand out.

â€œJust One Dayâ€ was the second single off of Skool Luv Affair.

Though this song has a similar theme to â€œBoy In Luvâ€ itâ€™s a much softer and and slower song. This allowed BTS to show off another side of their music for the first time in a single.

â€œDangerâ€ brought back the theme of young relationships. This time, the song expresses the angst of feeling like your feelings are stronger than the other personâ€™s. It also features a sound thatâ€™s influenced by both hip-hop and rock.

â€œWar Of Hormoneâ€ was released as the second single off the album and was met with some criticism over the lyrics for objectifying women. It even caused them to release a statement admitting that they reviewed the lyrics and realized they could be perceived as misogynistic but that it wasnâ€™t their intention during the writing process.

Since then, Big Hitâ€™s whole team and BTSâ€™ members have taken it upon themselves to meet with experts and read more books when they tackle sensitive subjects.

Personally, I donâ€™t actually find the songs lyrics to be that bad. Though itâ€™s comforting to know that BTS is always willing to take constructive criticism to better themselves.

(Japanese album)

1. Danger (Japanese Ver.)

2. é€²æ’ƒã®é˜²å¼¾ (The Rise of Bangtan â€“ SONPUB REMIX) (Japanese Ver.)

Wake Up was BTSâ€™ first Japanese album to feature songs that werenâ€™t on any previous BTS albums in Korean. However, none of the songs received their own music videos. The title track, â€œWake Up,â€ has similar themes to â€œNo More Dreamâ€ and â€œN.O.â€ as the lyrics detail the young menâ€™s exhaustion from being overworked and pressured by their parents.

â€œI NEED Uâ€ was the lead single for The Most Beautiful Moment In Life Pt.1 and also brought in a more pop sound for BTS. The members explained that itâ€™s about trying to hold on to love that is about to end and the anxiety that comes along with that.

â€œDOPEâ€ was the groupâ€™s first music video to surpass 100 million views on YouTube and got a lot of international attention as well. The song also touches on how young people struggle to succeed with the expectations placed on them.

Suga also explained in one of his unboxing videos that he was able to write his lyrics very quickly thanks to having fun working with the beat of the song.

â€˜FOR YOUâ€™

(Japanese album)

Release Date: June 17, 2015

Versions: Regular, A, B

FOR YOU Tracklist:

1. FOR YOU

2. ãƒ›ãƒ«ãƒ¢ãƒ³æˆ¦äº‰ War of Hormone (Japanese Ver.) Lyrics

â€œFOR YOUâ€ was the first BTS song on a Japanese album that wasnâ€™t on a Korean album to receive its own music video! Itâ€™s a soft, romantic song about longing to be with oneâ€™s partner as distance keeps them apart.

â€˜í™”ì–‘ì—°í™” Pt 2.â€™

The Most Beautiful Moment In Life Pt.2â€²

Release Date: November 30, 2015

Versions: Blue and Peach

í™”ì–‘ì—°í™” Pt 2. Tracklist:

2. RUN

3. Butterfly

6. ë±ìƒˆ Crow-Tit/Baepsae

â€œRunâ€ had lyrics included from many of the members including RM (Kim Namjoon), Suga (Min Yoongi), V (Kim Taehyung), Jungkook (Jeon Jeongguk), and J-Hope (Jung Hoseok).

BTS explained that the track takes on the difficulties of youth with daring lyrics. â€œWe didnâ€™t want to just blankly say â€˜cheer upâ€™ or â€˜be strong.â€™ We really wanted to comfort people our way, by producing the music and writing the lyrics ourselves. We poured our heart and soul into this amazing song.â€

â€œBaepsae,â€ also known as â€œSilver Spoon,â€ is inspired by the Korean proverb â€œWhen crow-tit walk like stork, its crotch will tear.â€

The song explains how young people are the crow-tit trying to keep up with the people in power, a.k.a. the storks, but end up ruining themselves in the process. Fueled by its powerful beat and choreography, the song has been a fan favorite for many years.

DKDKTV has a great explanation of this song in further detail from a Korean perspective.

â€˜I NEED Uâ€™

(Japanese album)

The music video for â€œI NEED Uâ€ (Japanese Ver.) is interesting because it was filmed with a much different theme from the Korean version, unlike some of the previous Japanese versions of songs that ended up with music videos very similar to the Korean versions.

â€˜RUNâ€™

(Japanese album)

The music video for â€œRUNâ€ (Japanese Ver.) has similar themes to the Korean version, but itâ€™s still pretty original with different scenes and locations.

â€œFIREâ€ has a similar theme to â€œRUNâ€ about how everyone makes mistakes with a much different sound.

With the impressive rap lyrics, the group chants, and the electronic-sounding pop, something about the song just makes you want to throw a house party.

Though released first, â€œSave Meâ€ is now often performed live with another track from Love Yourself: çµ Answer, â€œIâ€™m Fine.â€ The two songs are influenced by ambigrams. When flipped over, the words can be read as one or the other, and similarly the songs reflect that.

In â€œSave Me,â€ the lyrics reflect someone fighting depression and calling out for help, while in â€œIâ€™m Fineâ€ the lyrics show the person starting to recover from depression and in part thanking another person for helping them through it.

The lyrics for â€œBlood Sweat & Tearsâ€ were inspired by Demian by author Hermann Hesse.

RM explained the meaning behind the song, saying, â€œThe harder a temptation is to resist, the more you think about it and vacillate. That uncertainty is part of the process of growing. [Blood Sweat & Tears] is a song that shows how one thinks, chooses, and grows.â€

Suga also explained that, â€œThe song relays an optimistic determination to use our wings to go far, even if we are met with temptations in life.â€

With lyrics that start out by saying â€œYou worth it you perfect, Deserve it just work itâ€ the song â€œ21st Century Girlâ€ aims to help encourage women.

Itâ€™s pretty much a feminist anthem to inspire women to feel more comfortable in their own skin and ignore the pressure of society to be perfect.

â€˜You Never Walk Aloneâ€™

Release Date: February 13, 2017

Versions: Left and Right

You Never Walk Alone Tracklist:

1. Intro: Boy Meets Evil

2. Blood Sweat & Tears

3. Begin

4. Lie

5. Stigma

6. First Love

18. A Supplementary Story: You Never Walk Alone

â€œSpring Dayâ€ was written by RM and Suga about their experiences of missing someone close to them, while using the metaphor of the seasons to discuss how things always get better, much like spring after a long winter.

The song also draws inspiration from the novel The One Who Walks Away from Omelas, which is also referenced in the music video.

Many fans also believe that the lyrics of the song were inspired by the tragedy of the sinking of the MV Sewol. BTS and Big Hit Entertainment donated 100 million won (approximately $85,000) to the Sewol Ferry Disaster 416 Family Council, though there has been no official confirmation from the band that the song is related to the tragedy.

â€œNot Todayâ€ revisits the bandâ€™s anti-establishment theme from prior songs, and urges underdogs to continue fighting.

RM helped write the lyrics for this song as well, and the music video features the group dealing with masked assailants.

The music video from â€œè¡€ã€æ±—ã€æ¶™ Blood Sweat & Tearsâ€ Japanese version features mostly new scenes, with some from the Korean version mixed in, but the music video still keeps the same theme of the members facing different temptations and struggling to stay away from them.

â€œSerendipityâ€ was originally released as an introduction track on Love Yourself: æ‰¿ Her and then later released as a full track on Love Yourself: çµ Answer.

In an interview, RM described the meaning behind the lyrics by saying, â€œWhen I wrote the lyrics, melodies, and the first themes of â€œSerendipity,â€ I tried to come up with some rare things you find in life, something very special, like the calico, three-striped cat; things that have extraordinary meanings in peopleâ€™s lives. I wanted to share this moment.â€

â€œDNAâ€ became a historic song for BTS, helping them start to take over mainstream Americaâ€™s hearts. The group made their U.S. TV debut at the 2017 American Music Awards with a performance of â€œDNA.â€

RM also spoke about the meaning of the song. â€œWhen weâ€™re talking about our title tracks, â€˜DNAâ€™ is about the expression of a young, passionate love. The lyrics are like, â€˜The two of us are connected fatefully from the start, our DNA was just the one thing.â€™ At the same time, â€˜DNAâ€™ is taking BTS to new ground. We tried to apply new grammar and perspectives.â€

â€œDonâ€™t Leave Meâ€ didnâ€™t get its own music video but still became very popular and was even the opening theme of the Japanese TV series Signal (ã‚·ã‚°ãƒŠãƒ«).

â€œSingularityâ€ was also originally released as an introduction song on Love Yourself:è½‰ Tear only to be released again later on Love Yourself: çµ Answer. The song has a distinctive R&B vibe to it, fueled by singer Vâ€™s (Kim Taehyung) soulful voice.

The lyrics are poetic in nature as the song details a person who feels as though they have lost themselves for another person.

â€œFake Loveâ€ was said to be a very difficult song for the group to work on in their album preview V Live. The members revealed that they worked on the melody over and over again, trying to get it just right.

In an interview, RM also revealed more of the meaning behind the song. â€œWeâ€™re saying that if youâ€™re not true to yourself, your love wonâ€™t last forever. The love could be person to person, it could be between me and myself.â€

â€œIDOLâ€ brought together many elements of modern and traditional Korean culture, which can be heard in the song and seen in the music video as well.
